frameDefinitions: This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
This frame covers the basic uses of direction words like the adverbs east, up, and forward.
An Entity is undergoing a change in age typically associated with some deterioration or change in state.
A Topic or Stimulus fails or succeeds at causing an emotion in an Experiencer, which is conveyed by an Expressor or manifested in a State or description of an Event.
An Entity has existed for a length of time, the Age.
An Entity develops from a Prior_state to a Post_state.
frameExamples: Hawke's Bay winery <t>doubled</t> in size last year.
This building is twenty thousand years <t>old</t>.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Attribute</fen> is a scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.
The entity that has a position on the scale.
The distance by which an <fen>Item</fen> changes its position on the scale.
The position on the scale where the <fen>Item</fen> ends up.
The initial position on the scale from which the <fen>Item</fen> moves away.
A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the <fen>Attribute</fen> fluctuate.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state before the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
A description that presents the <fen>Item</fen>'s state after  the change in the <fen>Attribute</fen>'s value as an independent predication.
The <fen>Time</fen> is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs.
A location where Attribute is measured
The one-dimensional set of locations.
The <fen>Entity</fen> which is undergoing aging.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> ages.
This role indicates where the <fen>Entity</fen> is located.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, <fen>Event</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
The <fen>Entity</fen> for which a particular age is under consideration.
The feature of an <fen>Entity</fen> which is a function of the amount of time that the <fen>Entity</fen> has existed.
A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>Entity</fen>'s age.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Age</fen> from the norm.
The Frame Element <fen>Expressor</fen> marks expressions that indicate a body part, gesture or other expression of the <fen>Entity</fen> that reflect its age.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is at a particular <fen>Age</fen>.
The part of the <fen>Organism</fen> which is undergoing biological development.
The living thing whose <fen>Entity</fen> is undergoing development.
The relevant dimension of development.  Usually expressed by an entity-denoting adjective.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
The location where the <fen>Entity</fen> develops.
listRoleExamples: I fear <fex>this service</fex> will diminish in quality.
Diesels have increased <fex>from having a 20% market share in 1995</fex> to just over 30% in 2004.

It was never bad (1 or 2 seizures a year), but this past decade, it has increased
<fex>to having them 1 day a month</fex> and on that 1 day I have 6 or 7 seizures.
'Who's there?' she barked. 'Ensign Kim, ma'me,' the youngish voice of Voyager's young Harry Kim came over the comm line. '
The development <fex>of a human embryo</fex> is fascinating to study.
Rachel studies nervous system development <fex>in apes</fex>.
<fex>Embryonic</fex> development had been stunted by the disease.
<fex>Someday</fex> this bud will grow into a rose.
The cells were developing rapidly <fex>in the Petri dish</fex>.
